info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 18 at 6:10PM MDT by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Granite and west central Powell Counties through 700 PM MDT... At 610 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Drummond, moving north at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Drummond, Ovando and Helmville. This includes the following highways... Interstate 90 between mile markers 146 and 154. Highway 200 E between mile markers 38 and 57. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
